column4: I'm getting really slow network file transfers with my wireless LAN. Distance from the router is not the problem. I've got my devices set to 36Mb/sec, and the transfers are only about 7Mb/sec
not the router, the wifi adapter in your computer
ok, the one in my laptop is bcm43xx, and the one in my desktop is rt61pci
first of all, for rt61pci, you have to do "sudo iwconfig wlan0 rate 54M" to get full speed
for some reason, 36M seems to be optimal
for the broadcom, you have to upgrade to the "b43" driver instead of "bcm43xx"
i just used the restricted drivers for the bcm43
when i look at the connection information, the driver says b43
it's probably a limitation of your specific revision of the wrt54gs, then
wikipedia has a nice reference on them
well, what's odd is that it will transfer files at about 7Mb, and I can still download files from the internet at 6Mb(which is my connection maximum)
